reviewText: Beverly Brothers vs Steiner Brothers: A decent openerShawn Michaels VS Marty Jannetty: A good match and the feud of the year for 1993. Jannetty was pretty good back then.Big Bossman VS Bam Bam Bigelow: I was really looking foward to this match and it started good. Bossman then looked like he hurt his back and the match went in the toliet.Bret Hart VS Razor Ramon: A very good match but I thought the ending was quick and could have been better.Royal Rumble: It started off good and ended like crap. Savage tried pinning Yokozuna and Yokozuna kicks out and throws Savage over the ropes? Yea, I believed that one.One thing WWE fans may not know is from 1993-1997 (or Volume 2 of The Royal Rumble set), WWF would bring in foreign wrestlers and stars from independent companies to compete in the Rumble. This year-Carlos Colon (father of Primo and Carlito) and Genichiro Tenryu were in the Rumble. Tenryu was in a couple Rumbles and even a WrestleMaina match but I dont think he ever appeared on regular WWF tv. Jerry Lawler was host of a WWF show at the time but could be considered from anther company.Overall, a decent event with a few good matches. The Royal Rumble started strong  but as soon as Yoko entered, it was over.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the worst PPV shows of 1993 and maybe even all of the 1990's. The only GOOD matches were HBK-Marty Jannetty match even with the disappointing ending and the world championship bout between Bret Hart & Razor Ramon(Scott Hall) which was surprisingly good. The WORST matches were the Steiner Bros-Beverly Bros tag bout which was boring and the Big Boss Man-Bam Bam Bigelow fight which was a dud. The Royal Rumble match was and maybe still is trash with Giant Gonzalez's debut in this bout making it worse. I give this event a 2 out of 10.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This PPV put Razor Ramon on the map as a wrestler.  The Royal Rumble itself was horrible and Yokozuna was a bad choice for a winner.Bret Hart vs. Razor Ramon for the World Title.  This was a very good match and Razor Ramon put on a great show but in the end Bret retained the title. (3.5/5)Shawn Michaels vs. Marty Jannetty for the IC Title.  This was the best match of the night and everybody knew that HBK was gonna retain his IC Title. (4/5)Steiner Brothers vs. Beverly Brothers was very slow and boring and not very good action at all.  The Steiner Brothers win. (1.5/5)Bam Bam Bigelow vs. Big Boss Man was a pretty bad excuse for a match.  Bam Bam Bigelow returns and beats Big Boss Man. (0.5/5)Royal Rumble Match was a boring Rumble because all the guys were to far away in the numbers.  Why did they have to have Yokozuna win? (1.5/5)Overall this PPV was just bad like the 1992 Rumble.  Don't pick up this PPV at all but you should at least rent it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 1993 Royal RumbleJanuary 24, 1993Arco ArenaSacramento, CaliforniaBeverly Brothers V. Steiner BrothersI think this match went on too long for my liking. But, oh well. The Steiners wins in a decent match. **WWF Intercontinental Championship:Shawn Michaels (Champion) V. Marty JannettyThis match was awesome. It had a slow middle, but the beginning and end were awesome with Michaels retaining. **** Believe it or not...these two will have the match of the year in May on Raw with Jannetty winning the title. CoolBig Boss Man V. Bam Bam Bigelowthe only point to this match was for Bam Bam to get over a leaving Boss Man and lets leave it at that. *WWF Championship:Bret Hart (Champion) V. Razor RamonAnother awesome match. I like this match better than their King Of The Ring match. Great match with Bret retaining with the sharpshooter. ****Royal Rumble Match:Another Rumble that didn't have the big names in it. The ending saw Yoko and Savage and these two just wouldn't end the match. The last ten minutes was of Yoko kicking Savages ass. It took way too long. Yoko wins and goes to wrestlemania ***1/2Overall, a very good show that had two awesome matches, two matches that had no points but to put people over and a rumble match that could have been better but was fun to watch, like every Rumble match.
summary: For The First Time Ever...The Winner Of The Rumble Gets A Title Shot At WrestleMania!!!

reviewText: For perhaps the first time in WWF history, the 1993 edition of the Royal Rumble managed to create individual matches in the event (in this case Michaels/Janetty and Hart/Ramon) that overshadowed the Rumble itself.  Unfortunately, this was only because the Rumble was so weak in and of itself.Basically, besides a few guys (Ted DiBiase, Randy Savage, Undertaker) that were still likeable (although most of those were even past their respective primes), the entire "main event" consisted of nothing but "jobbers" (wrestle-speak for placeholders in between stars) and big fat guys (always go over better than shrimps).  It wasn't anything like years past, where every other guy would elicit a huge reaction (one way or another) from the crowd.Plus, although commentator Gorilla Monsoon is always excellent, Bobby "The Brain" Heenan again will make you want to watch the whole tape on "mute", which really takes away a lot of the fun (at least it would have in the Jesse "The Body" Ventura years).Overall, this is a very "skippable" event in your quest through the RR series.  It serves its purpose to advance the storylines into Wrestlemania and even puts together a few good stand-alone matches, but the main event is utterly boring.
summary: A Bunch Of Jobbers And Fat Guys
Title: N/A
